result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean M Pettis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $60.00 per month commencing 8/26/2022; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean M Pettis

records.addlTxt:
11:21 AM Defendant Sean M Pettis in court with attorney Priya Barnes.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for jury status hearing.
Parties have reached an agreement.
Prosecuting attorney moves to amend Count 2 to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Count 1 is dismissed and read in.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 2:
FINE: $ 267.50
	
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $ 60.00 per month commencing 8/26/22.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Jury status hearing on August 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Trial Order signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 6/8/22

Jury status hearing on August 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:48 AM Defendant Sean M Pettis in court with attorney Priya Barnes.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense advises Victim A is in court and would like to make a statement.
Statement by Victim A.
Defense requests matter be set for trial.
Jury trial expected to last 1 day.  Court will select an alternate juror.  Clerk to prepare a trial order.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on April 11, 2022.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

04:24 PM Defendant Sean M Pettis in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Prior: 2706 S Greeley St, Milwaukee, WI 53207
